des: "My mother made these all year round, she would just change the color of sugar in which they were dipped.  Consider putting a small amount of powdered drink mix (e.g.. Kool-Aid crystals) in white sugar to get different colors, and a little flavor. (Don't omit the sugar or the flavor will be too strong. )"
ins:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Cream together butter or margarine and  white sugar.  Add egg,  vanilla and  milk.   Mix well.
Gradually add flour, baking soda and salt.  Mix well.  Roll spoonfuls of dough in your hands and dip one end in colored sugar.  Place on baking sheets and press top down with a glass.  Bake for 12 minutes.
